meanings.definition: The branch of science that deals with the composition and properties of substances and various elementary forms of matter.
meanings.sent1: In chymics, scientists explore the elements that make up everything around us.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pursue a career in chymics to understand the building blocks of nature.
meanings.sent3: The chymics class had a fun experiment mixing different liquids to see their reactions.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a laboratory of chymics, constantly analyzing the world around him.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of chymics lies in unraveling the mysteries of matter and its properties.

meanings.definition: The study of the nature and properties of matter and energy.
meanings.sent1: Learning about chymics helps us understand the characteristics of materials and energy.
meanings.sent2: The professor's passion for chymics inspired many students to delve deeper into the subject.
meanings.sent3: During the science fair, the kids presented their chymics project on different types of energy.
meanings.sent4: Her fascination with chymics was like a never-ending journey through the wonders of the universe.
meanings.sent5: Exploring chymics is like unlocking the secrets of the physical world bit by bit.
